title: The Masked Singer: 'Bizarre' security measures used for toilet breaks
text:
Gorgi Coghlan witnessed first hand the strict - and downright bizarre - security measures used on The Masked Singer while filming the show in July and August.

The 44-year-old Project host, who was unmasked as 'the Monster' on Monday, told Nova FM that former military officers were even called in to keep an eye on things.

'We [the singers] did not know who each other was, it was so bizarre,' she began.

'We are not allowed to talk to each other. You had a little personal officer there, they were all ex-Army guys that looked after us,' she continued.

The security was ramped up when the contestants needed to use the bathroom, as producers feared they would use their moment of privacy to leak secrets and exchange gossip.

'If you wanted to go and do a wee, they walked in and would check the cubicle and they [would] almost pat you down,' Gorgi explained.

Top secret! Gorgi Coghlan (pictured) witnessed first hand the strict - and downright bizarre - security measures used on The Masked Singer while filming the show in July and August

'It was hilarious because you had to make sure no one was in the cubicle [trying to] work out if it was you.'

'They didn't let us listen to all the performances so we were all kept in our little caravan trailer and we weren't allowed to talk to anyone,' she added.

The Masked Singer placed a heavy emphasis on secrecy, with contestants keeping their involvement in the show from everyone, including their partners and children.

Odd! The Project host, who was unmasked as 'the Monster' on Monday, said that ex-military officers were called in to keep an eye on things and toilet breaks were closely monitored

Despite the lack of confirmed spoilers, few were surprised when the final three singers were unmasked on Monday night's episode.

After 'Monster' was unveiled as Gorgi, 'Wolf' was revealed to be Rob Mills and 'Robot' - the eventual winner - was unmasked as Cody Simpson.

The Masked Singer returns for a second season on Channel 10 next year.
